page.title: 18ST.CLEMENT WOODS, ST.ALLEN.
page.content: Bishop's,Lady's,& Lord's Woods make up St.Clement Woods,covering 114 hectares of Forestry Commission mixed woodland. Tree varieties include larch,Douglas fir,Western hemlock, Norway spruce, beech,Corsican pine & eucalyptus,with an area of original oak coppice at the site of an ancient fort. One plot of eucalyptus was killed by frost 5 years ago;the remaining plot is sprouting well up the old trunks.The woods are managed as productive woodland on a 50 year cycle & future plans are to plant Douglas fir mostly. Trees were planted from 1953 to 1965;first felling is now taking place nr.Lanner Mill, producing wood for stakes & pulpwood. High transport costs make it uneconomical to include this small area in national Forestry Comm. production,so timber is sold standing for contractors to fell it for local timber-merchants.
